	<item>
		<title>There’s a gorilla in the room and it’s not here to redecorate</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/16/theres-a-gorilla-in-the-room-and-its-not-here-to-redecorate/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/16/theres-a-gorilla-in-the-room-and-its-not-here-to-redecorate/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:34:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Walden]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Web]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[architecture]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Rebuild]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Technology Stack]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23835</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[Tom Britton, Co-Founder and CTO of Syndicate Room, takes a look at what you need to consider when planning a rebuild of your technology stack and system architecture. ]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/16/theres-a-gorilla-in-the-room-and-its-not-here-to-redecorate/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>0</slash:comments>
		</item>
		<item>
		<title>Catch up on the Azure Red Shirt Dev Tour with these resources</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/14/catch-up-on-the-azure-red-shirt-dev-tour-with-these-resources/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/14/catch-up-on-the-azure-red-shirt-dev-tour-with-these-resources/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Wed, 14 Feb 2018 15:57:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Walden]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Azure]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Event]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Azure Red Shirt Dev Tour]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Scott Guthrie]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23916</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[If you missed out on seeing Scott Guthrie at Tech Summit's Red Shirt Dev Tour and want to learn more about Azure, don't worry! Here are the resources and demos that were used at the event, plus a recording of the session in NYC.]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/14/catch-up-on-the-azure-red-shirt-dev-tour-with-these-resources/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>0</slash:comments>
		</item>
		<item>
		<title>Optimising Azure Spending</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/07/optimising-azure-spending/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/07/optimising-azure-spending/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Feb 2018 11:55:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Walden]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Azure]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Cost Optimisation]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23815</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[Chris Rhodes, Senior Training Instructor at IT Masterclasses, takes a look at some of the ways you can optimise the way you work to bring down the cost of the cloud. ]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/07/optimising-azure-spending/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>0</slash:comments>
		</item>
		<item>
		<title>An introduction to the Microsoft Bot Framework</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/02/an-introduction-to-the-microsoft-bot-framework-2/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/02/an-introduction-to-the-microsoft-bot-framework-2/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Fri, 02 Feb 2018 15:00:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Walden]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Bots]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[IoT]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Microsoft Bot Framework]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23735</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[Gary Pretty from Mando runs through what the Microsoft Bot Framework is and what you can do with it, as well as showing off a working example: the Timesheet Fridge!]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/02/02/an-introduction-to-the-microsoft-bot-framework-2/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>0</slash:comments>
		</item>
		<item>

		<category><![CDATA[SQL]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Tech Summit]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23705</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[Stella Chernyak, Senior Director for Microsoft 365 and Office 365 Enterprise Audience Marketing, kicks off Tech Summit with a look at Microsoft 365.]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/24/tech-summit-2017-create-a-modern-workplace-with-microsoft-365/feed/</wfw:commentRss>

		<item>
		<title>How to use microservices with Azure Service Fabric</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/22/how-to-use-microservices-with-azure-service-fabric/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/22/how-to-use-microservices-with-azure-service-fabric/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Mon, 22 Jan 2018 16:23:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Walden]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Azure]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Azure Service Fabric]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[microservices]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23675</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[What if one part of your application needs to scale but the others don’t? What if their high availability needs are different? Joining us to discuss monolithic applications and microservices is Mike Brown, Lead Azure Instructor at Firebrand Training.]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/22/how-to-use-microservices-with-azure-service-fabric/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>0</slash:comments>
		</item>
		<item>
		<title>Purchase a VM with Azure Reserved Virtual Machine Instances (RIs)</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/15/purchase-a-vm-with-azure-reserved-virtual-machine-instances-ris/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/15/purchase-a-vm-with-azure-reserved-virtual-machine-instances-ris/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Mon, 15 Jan 2018 15:59:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Walden]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Azure]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Reserved Instances]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[virtual machines]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23626</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[As of November 2017, you’re no longer limited to an operational expenditure model in Azure. By using Azure Reserved Virtual Machine Instances (known as RIs) you can change your cloud payment model to a capital expenditure model.]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/15/purchase-a-vm-with-azure-reserved-virtual-machine-instances-ris/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>0</slash:comments>
		</item>
		<item>
		<title>What are Azure Availability Zones and why should you use them</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/08/what-are-azure-availability-zones-and-why-should-you-use-them/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/08/what-are-azure-availability-zones-and-why-should-you-use-them/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Mon, 08 Jan 2018 15:03:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Chris Walden]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Azure]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Availability Zones]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23615</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[Mike Brown, Lead Azure Instructor at Firebrand Training, takes a look at the upcoming Azure Availability Zones and what they mean for your Azure projects.]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/08/what-are-azure-availability-zones-and-why-should-you-use-them/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>0</slash:comments>
		</item>
		<item>
		<title>5 Reasons Why You Should Consider Moving to Azure This Year</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/04/azure-5-reasons-to-move/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/04/azure-5-reasons-to-move/#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Thu, 04 Jan 2018 15:45:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Jacob McQuillan]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Azure]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Data]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Power BI]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Security]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Data Security]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23526</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[Thinking about moving to the cloud this year? Jacob McQuillan, Developer and Social Media Manager here at Microsoft, gives 5 reasons why you should choose Azure for your next cloud-hosted project]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/04/azure-5-reasons-to-move/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>1</slash:comments>
		</item>
		<item>
		<title>Data always tells a story</title>
		<link>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/02/data-always-tells-a-story/</link>
		<comments>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/02/data-always-tells-a-story/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Jan 2018 15:24:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Gavin Payne]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Data]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Power BI]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[analytics]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[data]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Microsoft Excel]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[SQL Server R Services]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/?p=23425</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[The difference between business intelligence and advanced analytics often attracts conflicting interpretations from users, vendors, and industry commentators. Gavin Payne explores these differences, and why business intelligence and advanced analytics are increasingly different.]]></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/uktechnet/2018/01/02/data-always-tells-a-story/feed/</wfw:commentRss>
		<slash:comments>0</slash:comments>
		</item>
